title: All "committing" commands should have -m|--message argument
body:
My use case currently:
```shell
datalad create -d . -m "Dataset with additionally preprocessed files" preproc
```
in which case ideally we should commit in super dataset the addition of the newly created subdataset with that message.  Messages for commits within preproc should be "automated" ones I guess (thus possibly relates to #3236 (automated commit messages)) but I would not even mind if the last one (currently "[DATALAD] new dataset") would be the one I have provided.

For such multi-commit executions I even wonder if solution could/should be similar, or may be even the same in implementation, to #3265 (`run` to cover multiple commits).  The idea of the "merge" commit to depict the end of the single action  kinda make sense in such scenarios.  In `create` it is a bit tricky (start from an "empty state commit") but doable AFAIK.

Similarly  `install` which is in the case of installing a new subdatset (e.g. `install -d . URL`) would generate commit within super dataset.

P.S. I though we had such an issue filed but couldn't find it. May be we discussed and closed already ;-)
